detailed_results.prompt: CAS issuance timeline
detailed_results.answer: UK universities typically issue a Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS) statement after an applicant has met all admission requirements and accepted an offer, generally within a few months of the course start date. detailed_results.prompt: show me guidance sources you used in your answer
detailed_results.answer: How has grade inflation in A-Levels impacted university admissions in the UK? Grade inflation has intensified competition for university places, particularly at highly selective institutions, as universities may rely more on other factors like personal statements and admissions tests to differentiate candidates. UCAS data and reports from the Office for Students confirm the trend of rising grades and the subsequent pressure on admissions processes.
